item.title: Environment Variables as a Program Bootstrap
item.author: rbergero@gmail.com (RJ Bergeron)
item.description: Environment Variables as a Program Bootstrap Previously, I talked about environment variables relating to system level environment variables. This article expands on that with an examples of a program that uses your environment to flexibly communitacte between components, demonstrating ways to effectively use those. An example with ssh-agent Using ssh-agent is a way to improve the usability of encrypted ssh keys - that is, you can have keys stored encrypted on disk, and the agent program will manage loading and unlocking keys for you.
